sen.j: 盛夏の六条院で、釣殿で涼んでいた源氏は夕霧 (源氏物語)を訪ねてきた内大臣家の子息たちに、最近新しく迎えられた落胤の姫君（近江の君）のことを尋ねる。
sen.e: In the height of summer, Genji, who cooled himself at tsuridono (fishing pavilion) in the Rokujo-in Palace, asked sons of the Minister of the Palace, who visited Yugiri, about a princess (Omi no Kimi) who was an illegitimate child but taken in to their residence recently.

sen.j: そこで長女弘徽殿女御の元に行儀見習いへ出すことを決めたが、女御へ贈られた文も和歌も支離滅裂な出来で、女房たちの失笑を買うのだった。
sen.e: So he decided to make her go to his oldest daughter, Kokiden no nyogo, to learn good manners, but a letter and a waka poem sent to her were illogical and invited court ladies' sniggers of contempt.
